issue.title: [CF 168] Not working quite right
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: Attaching a saved variables file/screenshot will increase the likelihood of your problem being solved.
Saved variables can be found in: "World of Warcraft/WTF/Account/<Account Name>/SavedVariables/TellMeWhen. lua"

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. There are many

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
There are many icons that I can't seem to get working in this version. I've included my saved variables and I'll list some examples as best as I can, sorry if it's so large I have plenty of alts with an elaborate display of icons.

Profile: Debria - Ragnaros
Group: 15 - Icon: 9
This icon is meant to show Combustion when it's available, it's checks that I'm combat, fire spec, and checks for the debuffs Living Bomb, Ignite and Pyroblast! on my target. It never shows, apparently the debuff check isn't working, if I make other icons with the debuffs and check those instead the icon works as intended.

Profile: Rubaina - Ragnaros
Group 14 - Icon: 1
This icon is supposed to track Prayer of Mending in a party. Can't get it to show, it works if I put to check player, but it doesn't work when checking the party

Profile: Yoshe - Ragnaros
Group 13 - Icon 4
This icon checks for when I'm missing the Inquisition debuff in my paladin, however it's set to only show only when I'm retribution, yet it still shows when I'm protection.

I suppose I can reconfigure around these issues to get each example to work, but hopefully this will help find issues with the addon you might have missed, or maybe I'm doing something wrong? I've check them many times trying to find out if I'm the one doing something wrong but I can't figure anything out.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
4.0.3


> Posted by CurseForge user Beruchan | Imported from CurseForge issue #168 | Raw

comments.body:
Attachment Added: TellMeWhen.lua

TellMeWhen.lua

<p>TellMeWhen config</p>


> Posted by CurseForge user Beruchan

Debria - Ragnaros: Your 5th condition is set to check if there are 5 stacks of pyroblast on the target.

Rubaina - Ragnaros: "party" isn't valid anymore, use "party1-4" instead.

Yoshe - Ragnaros: This is related to the way that conditions are checked, and will be able to be fixed when I implement ticket #167. Take the following:

``` false or true and true and false ```

Each true/false represents one of the conditions of g13i4. In this case, holy power isn't 3, but divine purpose is active, you are in combat, and you are not in ret spec. This evaluates to false.

Now, this:

``` true or false and true and false ```

means that holy power IS 3, divine purpose isn't active, you are in combat, and you are not in ret spec. This evaluates to true.

Being able to put parenthesis around things, like this:

``` (true or false) and true and false ```

will allow this to function correctly.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thanks for the reply.

That was an odd oversight with the Combustion, but I changed it to 1 stack and it still won't work. I also hadn't noticed the change in tooltip when it came to groups. And when it came to the paladin I thought it was handled (((A or B) and C) and D), anyway the parenthesis would be a lot of help.


> Posted by CurseForge user Beruchan

Whoops, found the problem. The debuff condition was just copy/pasted from the buff condition, but i forgot to change the filter from "HELPFUL" to "HARMFUL". This is on line 842 (or close to it) of conditions.lua if you want to change this yourself, as I am pretty busy and might not get the next version out for a few days.

Edited Apr 16, 2011
